result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J. Platta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Portage County Case 15CF332.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court grants 30 days to request restitution hearing.
All payment to be applied to Randall & Karen Fletcher first then to WEA Trust.
Court order 25% of all money deposited into the defendant's prison account be applied to the payment of fines, costs and restitution in this file.
If any fines, costs and restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Court order 25% of all money deposited into the defendant's prison account be applied to the payment of fines, costs and restitution in this file.
If any fines, costs and restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full-time, or a combination of both, resulting in full-time.
Defendant shall complete a psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.

Defendant is to have no contact with the victim, the victim's family or any other minor female unless given written approval of Agent.
Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and they are to be taken according to the prescription.
Defendant shall not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Defendant is to sign release of information forms for offender assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and or treatment.
Defendant shall provide Agent with list of medications.
Defendant is to use only one (1) pharmacy for prescriptions.
Defendant is to comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Defendant is to complete an alcohol assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Portage County Case 15CF332.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
various letters

Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant questioned and advised of rights

Court accepts Plea to Count #1 and finds the Defendant guilty of Count #1 
Court Dismisses and Reads In Count #2

PSI prepared in Portage County and per agreement of Counsel is to be used for todays sentencing. 
No Corrections were made to PSI 
Court and Counsel Discuss Written Statements by Victims
Sentence Recommendations by Counsel 
Statements by the Defendant
Court Sentences the Defendant to the State of Wisconsin Prison System for a period of 8 years.  
4 years of initial confinement and 4 years on extended supervision running consecutive to sentence in Portage County Case 15CF332 
Defendant is to pay costs including DNA surcharges, supervision fees and restitution with 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account being applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  
Restitution Summary filed for the amount of $16,331.07 with all payments being applied to the amount owed to Randall and Karen Fletcher first then to WEA Trust. 
Court further orders 30 days to request restitution hearing. 
If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Defendant shall complete a psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.
Defendant is to have no contact with the victim, the victim's family or any other minor female less given written approval by agent 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and they are to be taken according to the prescription. 
Defendant shall comply with any other assessments, Counseling and abide by Treatment recommendations. 
Defendant is to sign releases of information forms for offender assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and or treatment.
Defendant shall provide agent with list of medications.
Defendant is to use only one (1) pharmacy for prescriptions.
Defendant shall not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Defendant is to provide DNA sample for the state. 
Defendant is to complete alcohol assessment  & comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program
